alert.note: Alert for Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 1:47AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hancock, southern Van Buren, southwestern Lee, eastern Scotland and Clark Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Luray, or 8 miles northwest of Kahoka, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kahoka around 200 AM CDT. St. Francisville around 205 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wayland and Alexandria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
